timeline.title: Official Naming of Taekwon-Do
timeline.description: General Choi Hong Hi officially names the martial art 'Taekwon-Do', meaning 'the way of the foot and fist'.

detailed.background: After years of development and research, General Choi presented the new martial art to Korean military and political leaders.
detailed.significance: This marked the formal beginning of Taekwon-Do as a distinct martial art separate from other Korean martial arts.

timeline.title: International Taekwon-Do Federation Founded
timeline.description: General Choi establishes the International Taekwon-Do Federation (ITF) with nine founding countries.

detailed.background: The ITF was created to promote and standardize Taekwon-Do worldwide, separate from political influences.
detailed.significance: This established the global framework for ITF Taekwon-Do practice and dissemination.

timeline.title: First Taekwon-Do Encyclopedia Published
timeline.description: General Choi publishes the comprehensive 15-volume Encyclopedia of Taekwon-Do.

detailed.background: After decades of research and development, the complete technical system was documented.
detailed.significance: Provided standardized techniques, patterns, and philosophy for all ITF practitioners worldwide.

timeline.title: ITF Headquarters Moves to North Korea
timeline.description: Political pressures force General Choi to move ITF headquarters to Pyongyang, North Korea.

detailed.background: Due to political conflicts with the South Korean government, General Choi sought a new base for ITF.
detailed.significance: This move created a permanent division between ITF and WTF Taekwon-Do organizations.
detailed.impact: Led to the establishment of multiple ITF organizations with different headquarters.

timeline.title: Passing of General Choi Hong Hi
timeline.description: The founder of Taekwon-Do passes away in Pyongyang at age 83.

detailed.background: General Choi had been battling cancer while continuing to promote Taekwon-Do worldwide.
detailed.significance: Marked the end of an era and the beginning of multiple ITF successions.
detailed.lastWords: 'Taekwon-Do is for all mankind, for world peace and harmony.'

timeline.title: Multiple ITF Organizations Emerge
timeline.description: Following General Choi's death, several ITF organizations form with different leadership.

detailed.background: Disagreements over succession led to the formation of multiple ITF groups.
detailed.significance: Created diversity in ITF practice while maintaining core technical principles.
majorGroups: ITF headed by Prof. Chang Ung
ITF headed by Master Tran Trieu Quan
ITF headed by Grand Master Pablo Trajtenberg

timeline.title: Global ITF Taekwon-Do Community
timeline.description: ITF Taekwon-Do continues to grow worldwide with millions of practitioners.

detailed.background: Despite organizational differences, the technical curriculum remains largely unified.
detailed.significance: ITF Taekwon-Do maintains its identity as a traditional martial art with modern applications.
detailed.currentState: Practiced in over 140 countries with regular world championships and seminars.
